content: My money gone in drain, when I send an article it's saying I am not a pateron
replyContent: Hi Prabhu, our paid Push to Kindle Android app has no sending limit (you don't need to be a patron). Our free desktop browser extensions, however, let you send 30 articles a month for free. To send more than that you will need a Patreon subscription. I think you're using the free desktop browser extension and not the Android app that you purchased.

content: Wonderful support staff. They responded to my request about an issue with their desktop firefox plug-in within hours, even though I wasn't a paying customer. I purchased their Android app immediately because of their dedication to improving their app and haven't had any issues. One suggestion: I take notes regularly on "Simple Note". Will "Push to Kindle" also support non-web-based articles, such as personal notes on "One Note" or "Simple Note" in the future? That would be awesome. Thanks!
replyContent: Many thanks, A A. Appreciate the support. As for your question, we do hope to offer better support for non-web-based articles in the app. At the moment that's only possible via our web-based paste pad, which isn't optimised for mobile use yet: https://pastepad.fivefilters.org

content: I love the experience of finding an article on my smartphone and sending to my kindle
Worth a few bucks for an app that does what it says, and well. FiveFilters does great work. I'm happy to support them. This is the best app for sending articles to my Kindle.

Updated Oct 2020: it's still the best app to send articles to your Kindle. The best android software to read your web articles clutter free without ads on your Kindle. You do not need to own a Kindle device to use this service. Well worth all the money!
Nearly perfect! Only problem I noticed was the indentation inside code blocks, but from what I heard, you're already aware of it and it should be fixed soon.

Sending the article was fine, formatting has some issues though. I tried it out on a medium article which I figured would be pretty easy, and it got the picture at the top of the article converted flawlessly, along with the title, but for some reason it just cut out the majority of the article and only gave me what was under one of the headers in the middle.
replyContent: Hi KC, sorry about the trouble. We recently updated the way we handle Medium articles to fix a few issues. It seems in doing so we broke formatting on other Medium articles (those which contains large headings lower down). Fixed now, so if you're able to try again, please do. (You will have to wait a few hours if you're trying the same article.)

content: Works flawlessly. I read more because of this.
Works as intended.

Amazing! Had to add the app's email account to my send-to-kindle trusted list to make it work but that was easy. I'm loving this and has changed my reading experience for the better. Thank you so much!

Amazing experience. This app allows you to push articles to your Kindle while stripping out the ads. If you often find yourself distracted while reading on your phone or laptop, this is the app for you.

Excellent app, it formats and sends web pages to the Kindle e-reader. Suggestions: 1) do not remove links but add them as numbered references at the end of the page. 2) add the option to completely remove pictures. Update: I've now been using this for several months and it's a great app, it just works and it's very reliable. Is there a way to send a small tip for this?
replyContent: Thanks for the review, Giovanni, and the suggestions. We're going to look into implementing both of these in a future release. Appreciate the feedback.

content: Does not work with Seeking Alpha the app, whenever trying to send a doc over it'll say sorry cannot sent...
replyContent: Hi Mike, sorry to hear that. Certain sites and apps will present their content in a way that's not easily accessible. If you're able to share, but instead of choosing Push to Kindle, choose email and send us a copy of what the app puts in the email - usually the URL of the article - we'll be able to take a look. E-mail us at: help@fivefilters.org

content: Didn't work for me.
replyContent: Hi Tsvetan, sorry to hear you had trouble. Can you tell us what the issue is? Does the app say it can't send the article? Does it say "sent!" but you're not receiving it on your device? We have some troubleshooting tips here https://help.fivefilters.org/push-to-kindle/troubleshooting.html but you can also email us at help@fivefilters.org for help.

content: I use with my two past generations Paperwhite model and did with previous. Great for transferring text of articles and website text content, plus accompanying photos and graphics into black and white format of Kindle. I like getting some reading time by E-Ink , besides the LCD readout phone and computers. Push to Kindle helps make that possible.

It worked fine, with occasional errors, for a long time. Unfortunately, recently I need to confirm every delivery separately in my email, which is not very handy, as it takes much time and the confirmation link expires in 48 hours. I guess it's because Amazon changed security settings, but maybe you could make it easier to send articles?
replyContent: Hi Agata, sorry about the trouble. This is an annoying change at Amazon's end. If the 'send to' address and 'send from' addres look similar, you'll have to verify each time. But you can change one of these to avoid that. Please see https://forum.fivefilters.org/t/having-to-verify-kindle-docs-despite-using-an-approved-email/798/2 for guidance.

content: Push to Kindle works well and the developers are responsive to reports about ever-changing websites.
replyContent: Hi Dan, thank you for the feedback. We do look for the author but sometimes site changes prevent us from finding the relevant data. We've now fixed this for NY Times and The Atlantic. If you find other sites where the author isn't included, please email us at help@fivefilters.org. We'll try to improve automatic author detection in future versions.

content: Push to Kindle works extremely well. Recently, I thought it had stopped working with Medium. I later realized that I had tried to send the article twice, when my kindle was out of WiFi range. Apparently you only get to send once with that app or something, which is no problem, but if you have difficulty sending something, maybe make sure you haven't already received it. Just a question for the developers: is this a setting on your end, or on Medium's?
replyContent: Hi Michelle, we did experience some server trouble today, so it might have been related to that. But we don't do anything to prevent the sending of an article twice. Some sites do limit access (or repeated access) to their articles in various ways, so that might be an explanation. If you still have trouble, please email us help@fivefilters.org

content: When I push to kindle it is pushed to free.kindle that gives me an email to download the book, not pushed to my kindle. From the web application it works as desired.
replyContent: Hi Cornel, Amazon sends that email automatically if you send to your free.kindle.com address. But it will not affect delivery if you're using a Kindle device connected to Wi-Fi. If you don't want the confirmation email you can open Push to Kindle from your apps list (not the share menu) and change the 'Send to' field to Kindle email (Whispernet)

content: This app has made Kindle my go-to format for reading. I have a lot of Kindle books already. On my phone I started out using Pocket to save long form essays to read later, and sometimes I use Evernote, but it's nice to have all my reading in one place. This app works well, and more and more it's the main one I use.
Does not work. Tried many times. Files do not send to kindle. I am entering the correct info but it does nothing. Waste of money.
replyContent: Hi Sebastien, we have a troubleshooting page at https://help.fivefilters.org/push-to-kindle/troubleshooting.html If that doesn't help, we suggest sending a document (e.g. Word doc) as an attachment to your Kindle email address (not with Push to Kindle) to see if it arrives. We're happy to help or give you refund if you email help@fivefilters.org

content: A día de hoy la mejor aplicación para enviar contenido al kindle que he encontrado. Instalada y funcionando. (La antigua de Send2Kindle que tenía quedó abandonada, dejó de marchar, y ya ni aparece en Play Store)
Good app, but now it stopped work and just writes:"Sorry, couldn't sent..." Idi why it doesn't work.. And when I try to enter my email address, everything with and after @ is deleted.. Why?.....
good
it just works, simple and easy.
Works like a charm

It used to work perfectly and still does on one of my phones but it's 
stopped working on my S8 running Android 8. I presume that it's an OS issue.
replyContent: Hi Bobby, Push to Kindle version 2.4 which we've just released addresses issues users have had with Android 8 and Android 9 (the errors were mostly related to data saving and battery saving modes on the phone, which prevented background data access). If you're able to give it another try, please do so and let us know if you still have trouble.

content: This has recently stopped working for me. every time I try to send I get an error message.
replyContent: Scott, sorry about the trouble. We have fixed this issue in the latest release (version 2.4). Can you please upgrade and try again. If you still get an error, please let us know.

content: The app recently stopped working altogether. I will sometimes get an error message but usually just no response at all. The fact that Amazon makes it so difficult for you to use the kindles basic functions is incredibly annoying. I'll probably just throw it in the trash at this point because I resent this company so very very much. I hate Google also. May all of you silicone valley vampires encounter the wrath of God and burn in hell eternal for your crimes against free humanity. I curse you all
replyContent: James, sorry about the trouble you experienced. We have fixed this issue in the latest release (2.4). The service itself wasn't the issue (no changes on our side) but recent Android versions require changes to apps using background network activities, which meant in some modes (data saving/power saving) our app was not being permitted data access.

content: Please help! This app does not work on my phone any more. I struggle to fix this. Could you help me?
replyContent: Phi, we have released an update (version 2.4). Can you please try it and let us know if you still have trouble. If you do, please email help@fivefilters.org and we'll do our best to help.

content: Works sometimes
replyContent: Hi Justin, if you were getting network errors occasionally (we found some users with data saving or power saving mode enabled would get these), we have just released Push to Kindle version 2.4 to address the issue. If you're able to, please try it out and let us know if it helps.

content: This app is amazing. I usually use web version, but bought to support developers. however, when you convert code, it always ends up being 4 spaces indented on first line only. if this was fixed it give 5 stars. i also wish you could send epubs and stuff. but that's not critical.
replyContent: Thanks for the review, Michael, and really appreciate your support. We'd be happy to look into the code issue if you could send us the article(s) where the code block isn't preserved correctly. You can email us at help@fivefilters.org if you'd like to do that. Thanks agian.

content: Used to work fine. Now, keep getting error message : unable to send. Check network access. Have changed the power settings on my phone and now working perfectly. Maybe a troubleshooting FAQ would help? Back to 5 stars :-).  App is simple to use and very effective.
replyContent: Dermot, sorry about the trouble. If you have power/data saving mode on, your device is likely restricting background data access, which will prevent our app from sending articles. Try disabling power/data saving or enabling "unrestricted data access" for Push to Kindle. See https://support.google.com/googleplay/answer/1663315?hl=en we'll fix soon.

content: I had some problems with the app initially, but now it's working fine.

Can you add a feature where I can send this to multiple Kindle accounts at once? I have two kindles in the family and want to share across both of them Thanks for the response. Yes I figured that out and am able to send it to multiple users
replyContent: Hi Mohit, it's possible to send to more than one Kindle by using a comma in the "Send to" field. E.g. to send to kindle1@kindle.com and kindle2@kindle.com, you'd enter: "kindle1,kindle2". You can do this for up to 5 devices. The Amazon Kindle accounts will need to have the 'Send from' address in their Amazon Kindle approved list, however.

content: Perfecta para enviar artículos largos al Kindle, y se puede leer cómodamente incluso respeta los espacios entré imaginés y párrafos valio la pena el pago
Very convenient
Tested with Aeon.co and it works like a charm. Perfect app which also comes with great support (thanks Keyvan!).
Sometimes there's error message about Network error. Anyway to solve? And would you please consider to send multiple users?
replyContent:
Hi, you can send to multiple Kindle addresses by using commas. So if you want to send to kin1@kindle.com and kin2@kindle.com enter 'kin1,kin2' in the 'send to' field in the app. The send from address has to be valid on both though.

As for network errors, we've just released version 2.4 which should fix the issue.

content: fantastic app and experience, exceedingly simple and fast to use, almost completely invisible beneath it's purpose, but unfortunately stopped working for me recently. After a full minute, if I glue my eyes to the screen, I get a message saying error: ensure network connection. I have followed the troubleshooting advice with no success.
replyContent: Hi Tyson, apologies for the network issues you experienced. We have just released Push to Kindle version 2.4 which should fix the network problems. If you're able to try it out, please do so and let us know what you think.

content: great! hope will have more features in the future!
very useful but I have a trouble with sending network error cab you handle this? it makes me crazy

If you still have trouble, please let us know at help@fivefilters.org (or updating your review here) and we'll look into it.

content: Awesome, turning off battery saver worked, Thank you. Any news on if the app will ever be Patreon Compatible?
replyContent: Hi again Josh, just an update to let you know Push to Kindle version 2.4 which we just released should work in battery and data saving modes too. As for Patreon compatible, I'm not sure I understand?

content: We need to send direct to Kindle without free service. Because i receive too much emails for each article i have sent. يدعم العربية ١٠٠%
it works! I was using a similar free app but that stopped working! push to kindle seems to work fine and fairly quick too

replyContent: Hi Marco, thank you for the feedback. We'll definitely consider adding something like that in the future. The main use case is, however, as you describe: sending articles viewed in the browser or another app.

content: simply does what you need... sending articles to your kindle

Great app, does just what it promises.
So thankful for this app. Just another big help in trying to avoid my pc while using a smartphone is often a better option. Buying a lot of extra rest by paying for this app :-)
great app, using it for years
replyContent: Hi there, sorry about the trouble with the 'network unavailable' error, and this very late reply to your review. Newer versions of Android on certain devices appears to be causing this. We released an update today which we think fixes the issue. If you're still willing to give it another go, please try and let us know if you still have trouble.

content:
Extremely useful, safe and reliable. One single touch and a perfect copy 
will be available on Kindle. Well worth the price!
Best app ever! Very useful. Love it

Does what it says. The instructions could be clearer (I think the issue I had was I didn't realize I had to approve the app's address in the Kindle settings but it was a while ago). Once I did get it set up it's been smooth sailing and the extraction of articles is generally pretty good.
Doesn't work anymore :(

Have you looked at our help pages to see if your email addresses are set correctly? http://help.fivefilters.org/customer/en/portal/topics/67288-push-to-kindle/articles Our troubleshooting page might help if it's previously worked okay http://help.fivefilters.org/customer/en/portal/articles/1292971-troubleshooting

content: I absolutely loved this app but all of a sudden it stopped working! I've uninstalled and reinstalled it multiple times, I've cleared the cache, and I've restarted my phone but it still doesn't work.  Update: Received an email from the developer, explaining that something had happened to the mail server but it was up and running now. Went to test it and everything works like it should!
replyContent: Hi there, I'm sorry about the trouble. Our mail server developed an issue around 2 hours ago which resulted in emails not being sent out. It should be working again now, but I'm afraid you'll have to resend what you had previously tried to send. Sorry about the inconvenience.

content: The best app ever to push data for offline reading. Tried different competitors, however this one formats text the best!

replyContent: Hi Ben, sorry for the late reply, just seen this now. There were some issues with apostrophes (depending on how they were marked up) which has now been resolved. If you get a chance to try again, please do.

content: Works perfectly every time.
Just plain lovely.
Works absolutely flawlessly, highly recommended

This is a very handy and useful app. Of late, I've been having some issue with sending mobile Reddit articles. It could not send them whereas it used to not a few days ago. I sent an e-mail asking to look into this and was told after a bit of a delay that the content of the mobile Reddit has been modified and is loaded in through Javascript, so Push to Kindle cannot get at the content. So if you're looking into using this on similar websites, be aware of this issue.
Perfect app.

The problem still hasn't been fixed, that sometimes (most times?) authors' names do not transfer with articles. The Send to Kindle extension on my computer allows the user to add the name before sending if it doesn't insert it itself. That would be a very helpful addition to this app.
replyContent: Thank you for the feedback. At the moment the author name is only included if the website has marked it up in such a way that we can detect it. If we can't, there's no way yet to add that in yourself. But we'll definitely consider it.

content: Includes both words and pictures.

Amazing! Literally i only had it for 10 minutes so far but i already love it. This is so useful and exactly what I was looking for. Could you possibly create something that automates this? Like set RSS feeds that will send as one document each day with the latest news to the kindle? (I think programming wise it can be done and it would be awesome)

This app worked perfectly at first - however I can't seem to send anything since the Kindle software update downloaded to my Paperwhite last week. Is there an issue with the update? Are others having this problem?  Update: There was a bit of a glitch but it only lasted a day - and it's been working perfectly ever since. Thanks for such a great app!
replyContent: Hi Meghan, sorry to hear you're having trouble. We're not aware of an issue. Can you log in to your Amazon Kindle account and check if the articles appear in pending deliveries. If they do, they're reaching your account okay. If not, it might be an email issue. More help: http://help.fivefilters.org/customer/portal/articles/1292971-troubleshooting

content: Hi thank you for your replying. I'm sure I entered my emaill adress properly. I checked the page you gave me so manny times already... help me I really want this app

It is a simple yet brilliant solution if u are an avid Web article/news reader. Weather you are browsing Web or news in an app simple push the share button and choose send to kindle, and the article appears in ur kindle library. It is even better than the official kindle extension since it sends the page in article mode and NOT IN PDF Version which is just amazing
Formatted my Web pages perfectly, very easy to use.
very great app

Does a great job of pushing *to* the Kindle. The text formatting in the Kindle is clean and generally free of stray elements that interrupt the flow of the text. And becuase I also have the Kindle for Android app installed on my Nexus 5 and associated with the same Kindle device, when I PTK an item, it simultaneously arrives in both my Kindle and my Nexus. That's nice.  But each time I use the mobile PTK app, it generates an email alerting me to the fact that I have just PTK'd an item to my Kindle. This is unnecessary and annoying because it clutters up my inbox. The PTK app itself already announces success each time it sends an item to my Kindle; I don't need a redundant reminder in my inbox.  Checking the PTK app settings, I don't see any obvious way to disable the automatic email. Nor can I find any obvious equivalent on my Amazon Manage Your Kindle page.
Arabic letters appears separated..should be connected to each other... The other free app send it quite well.

This is exactly what I needed. Love that I can push articles I find, to my Paperwhite, and read them in the evening, without the drawbacks of phone/tablet/pc backlight. Also, does a great job of formatting, providing a pleasant reading experience.
I want to have your children.
Must have for any Kindle owner that wants to effortlessly read text found on the internet on their device.
Even when sharing inside of other reader-apps like Pocket

Works exactly as I hoped, except for one very important problem which is a deal breaker--and frankly so bad I'm amazed it hasn't been fixed. The article title is not used, instead it uses the name of the website. For example I shared Atlantic magazine online article, and it appeared in my kindle as "Atlantic". This is a bug, & a serious one. Otherwise this would have been perfect.
replyContent: Hi Paul, that's strange, the article title should be used. Can you point me to an article from The Atlantic where this isn't happening? (I just tested an article from the site and can't reproduce this issue - the title appears correctly.) Feel free to email us at help@fivefilters.org

content: App is now working perfectly. Contacted Amazon the other day and was informed they had a technical glitch in their personal document delivery service. Thumbs up to the developer anyway for responding to my earlier feedback.
replyContent: Hi Meta, can you tell us what kind of device you're sending your articles to? On Android, the latest update of the Kindle app seems to work fine for us. We could read and send articles as before. Feel free to email us at help@fivefilters.org [Thanks for the update! :)]

content: After the recent update of kindle Voyage, this app could not push anything to my kindle..... Then, after one or two hours of jam, it works again, but this time it gives me a lot of anti communist articles I don't even know where it comes from. This is weird, so weird.
replyContent: Hi there, I'm sorry you're having trouble with the app. Just to be clear, we do not send articles except those users explicitly choose to send to their Kindle. We're happy to try and help figure out what's going on here. Please email us at help@fivefilters.org if you'd like support.

content: I use the Chrome browser on Android and this app has been completely reliable in my use (about a year). One time I even used it in lieu of Amazon's desktop version which failed to send the same page. Easy and quick to use. Love it.

replyContent: Hi Avia, sorry to hear you had trouble. There's no word/length limit, but it works better on some sites than others. We're always improving it, so if you want to send us the article or website you tried to use with Push to Kindle, we can improve our extraction rules to ensure the full article is processed. Email help@fivefilters.org or reply here.

content: Crashing on my nexus 7 although it shares the matter but "stop working" msg pop ups which is very annoying. Purchased

Easy way to move articles off my phone and on the Kindle. I wish it had an option NOT to send a copy to my kindle archive as does the chrome extension  Send to Kindle.
replyContent: Thanks Steve, unfortunately archiving is not something we can control, but you can disable it from within Amazon's Kindle management site. It will disable archiving for everything sent to your Kindle addresses, so may not be what you want. http://www.amazon.co.uk/gp/help/customer/display.html/ref=kinw_myk_wl_ln?ie=UTF8&nodeId=200767360#pdocarchive

content: When you press 'share page' and choose Push To Kindle, the article is delivered to your Kindle Reader app in just a few minutes.
Simple and to the point. Love it so I can save articles or recipes immediately. Easy excess since I read from kindle apps all the time. Thanks for a great app.
Dev even added whispernet. Cool app :-)

I'll cut to it..  You see a Web page and want to read it later on when you have more time or when on the train without an Internet connection. Well this is it,  simple to setup and the layout is spot on.   Probably my best £1.50 I e ever spent on an App.  SUPPORT IT PLEASE AND BUY.
Simple app that does the job
Works well and simple to use, kudos!
This is the one you're looking for

This app is great for reading anything you want that you find is long enough to read from the mobile devices. It, as promised, converts almost any type of Web pages to a easily readable format. Just click share and you are ready to go! And finally if you have any problems, there is quick responsive staff there to help you.

I initially had problems with the app on my end, I emailed the dev and he responded in minutes!  Everything got sorted out and the app works great.   Download this app. It makes reading online content so much easier and let's you keep it for offline reading. Spectacular.
Great app; simple & quick! Was using Pocket to grab articles online and from apps but I wanted to be able to highlight & add notes like kindle does. Went looking around & found this.

This app has very high usability and its a very intuitive app I have come across. The app works as committed and pushes my webpages to my kindle app. I am personally delighted and its worth of every penny.

I don't buy too many apps.  I've bought a few games, but most productivity apps can be had for free—unfortunate as that may be for the brilliant developers out there.  With the unrivaled resolution of HTC Rezound, and the perfect-book-reading size screen of my Nexus 7, I'v recently fallen in love with reading books/news, etc on my small and mid-size screens!    When it comes to reading long text on the web, the built-in browser on the Rezound (Internet app) excells resizing just the portion of the web page I want to read.  Chrome (Nexus 7), however, fails that task.    Either way, reading in a good e-reader (Kindle app, Google Books, Aldiko) is a MUCH nicer experience!  Now, whenever I'm working and I come across a LONG article that I don't have the stamina to read sitting up at my workstation, I simply send it to Kindle, wait a minute or two (just enough time to go get comfy on the couch) and start reading in leisure.    I'd LOVE to see the developers create another app, "Push to Google Books". I would read everything in Google Books if that were an option (more/better reading options), but I'm not complaining.  Truly my favorite and the most useful app I've ever paid for!

Definitely one of the most useful apps I have, and I use it a lot. Easy to use, fast, and the results are great. Perfect for when I find something to read but don't want to read it on a tiny screen, or just don't have the time. I recommend this to anyone who loves to read on a kindle!
great
App works exactly as billed and is very intuitive.  I had a question for the developer and got a full, personal response in less than 10 minutes.  Already feel I've gotten my money's worth.
Does what it says and in the easiest way possible.  I use it to send articles that I get via rss. I just go to my list, select the articles and send them without having to open them.  Great!

I've been using a couple of different ways to push internet articles to my Kindle on Chrome, but this one seems to work even better than them, the formatting is fantastic. Thanks so much for a great product!!
Only improvemnt would be a send it later option like the firefox addon so you can send multiple pages as one file, many articles have more than one page
Despite the free alternative (send to kindle), I'm paying for this to support a great app and ffox extension. Great work, thanks!

I'm constantly coming across articles and essays I want to read, while browsing the net on my phone, and with this, I can effortlessly send those pages to my Kindle and read them how I like and when I like. Love it.
By far the most used app on my phone. Great for sending articles to kindle app to read offline. It also detects the language of the article which is an enormous plus. Great work.
It works very well. I'm also using the Firefox plugin that it's great.
I don't have a kindle but I like reading on my kindle app. This just works perfectly. Well worth the money. L
So far the perfect solution for me. And a pretty ethic developer too. Thanks for the great app.
Formats pages nicely, uses site URL as author, very useful for compiling a list of pages or papers to read through.
I had come to depend on sending docs from browsers on pcs. So glad I can do this from Android. Worth paying for.
I first tried SEND TO KINDLE which I found out doesn't work w/ the kindle APP. KINDLE IT allowed me to download to my Kindle App...it worked great!
Cuts out the Instapaper middleman and allows me to easily organize articles in collections on the Kindle.
One of the best apps I have! So easy to read stuff later on my kindle! Amazing! You won't regret buying it! Worth the £1.50
I wanted to try first because Send-to-Kindle kept crashing on my phone. This was pricy compared to free, but now i think it deserves it; this works!
Does just what it says. So far so good. :)
